alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Orange, southern Caledonia, southern Essex, southeastern Addison, northern Rutland, Windsor and southeastern Washington Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lancaster to Pittsford. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barre, Rutland, St. Johnsbury, Woodstock, Chester, Lyndon, Braintree Hill, Bradford, Killington, Rutland City, Websterville, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Pomfret, Hartland, Fairlee, Mount Holly, Sharon, Washington, Shrewsbury and Kirby. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 48. Interstate 91 between mile markers 54 and 71, near mile marker 73, between mile markers 75 and 91, between mile markers 94 and 121, and between mile markers 123 and 134. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
